content.webTitle: Scottish National Jazz Orchestra: American Adventure – review

fields.headline: Scottish National Jazz Orchestra: American Adventure – review
fields.bodyText: US vocal star Kurt Elling guests on this Scottish National Orchestra session recorded in New York last year, singing a delicate and beautifully arranged account of Duke Ellington's Sound of Love; other celebrity guests here include guitarist Mike Stern, saxophonists David Liebman and Bill Evans, and trumpeter Randy Brecker. They pull out all the stops in order to match SNJO's enthusiasm and technique: Stern's purrs and feints rise up from Fred Sturm's sinewy remake of Marcus Miller's Splatch into a howling funk dialogue with drummer Alyn Cosker, while vibraphonist Joe Locke's cruising bebop lines unveil new twists to Wayne Shorter's Yes or No, and Bill Evans ducks, dives and thunders his way through Chick Corea's Quartet No 1 (Part 2). With the atmosphere of a live show, it's further testament to the SNJO's commitment and class, and a great set for big-band fans and admirers of the star soloists alike.
